listitem.para: Generate a server key and keystore
listitem.programlisting: $ cd jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/standalone/configuration $ keytool -genkey -alias server -keyalg RSA -keystore server.keystore -storepass password -keypass password -dname "CN=localhost" -validity 365

listitem.para: Add an https connector definition and an https redirect-port to the web tier
listitem.programlisting:
<subsystem xmlns="urn:jboss:domain:web:1.1" default-virtual-server="default-host" native="false"> <connector name="http" protocol="HTTP/1.1" scheme="http" socket-binding="http" redirect-port="8443"/>
<connector name="https" protocol="HTTP/1.1" scheme="https" socket-binding="https" secure="true" enable-lookups="false"> <ssl password="password" certificate-key-file="/opt/jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/standalone/configuration/server.keystore" protocol="TLSv1" verify-client="false"/> </connector>
<virtual-server name="default-host" enable-welcome-root="true"> <alias name="localhost"/> <alias name="example.com"/> </virtual-server> </subsystem>

listitem.para: Navigate to the root page for the server using HTTPS

note.para: JBoss provides several built-in security domain solutions. A simple one (called "other") based on login and realm is based on a set of user and role property files. No matter which role we choose and optionally later improve -- our application will work the same.
